q: search product. But Microsoft and several travel firms oppose the purchase, saying it would unfairly benefit Google. At the time, Google CEO Eric Schmidt brushed aside questions about the feds blocking the deal. We are pretty comfortable that because of the unique nature of travel search, that[ the deal] is pro-competitive and pro-consumer, Eric Schmidt said. But the feds have been studying the deal for months now, and in December, Google reportedly used a regulatory provision that gives the feds 30 days to file suit or approve the deal

The Crown Prosecution Service has also asked a senior QC to "comprehensively" re-examine material amassed as part of the original inquiry and any new evidence. In his resignation statement, Mr Andy Coulson said: Nothing is more important than the Government's task of getting this country back on its feet. "Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110% needed in this role. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman it's time to move on. Mr Andy Coulson joined Mr David Cameron 's team before the General Election and then ran the PM's communications strategy. Labour leader Ed Miliband said the row raised "real questions about David Cameron 's judgement

opinion, Larry is ready to lead, and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come," Eric Schmidt said. Page praised Eric Schmidt , too. There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly, he said. The change in command, effective April 4, overshadowed Google's fourth-quarter profit report, which soared past Wall Street analysts' estimates as the company cranked up its Internet marketing

her eyes. "When her husband saw her making this effort he urged her and said Gabrielle Giffords open your eyes, open your eyes. And sure enough she did," said Kirsten Gillibrand . I was there when she was surrounded by her friends in the Congress and Senate. And I think it was a combination, perhaps, of the unexpected and the familiar that really prompted her to open her eyes and look around, said her doctor, Dr. Michael Lemole. But it was Gabrielle Giffords ' husband's reaction to this milestone that made Kirsten Gillibrand realize this was the very first time Gabrielle Giffords had opened her eyes since being shot.

founded Google in 1998 with fellow Stanford University graduate student Sergey Brin , has long been considered the firm's thought leader, driving strategy and pushing the company into new areas as far afield as wind energy. Despite rocker David Archuleta Cook's surge in recent weeks, the judges were uncharacteristically united in proclaiming early fan favorite teen David Archuleta had outperformed his rival. You came out here tonight to win, and what we have witnessed is a knockout, said prickly judge Simon Cowell .
